Kraken - Bachelor Praktikum

Mechanical Engineering Project Simulation System

{/* Project Content */}

Project Overview

Kraken is a comprehensive simulation system developed for mechanical engineering projects. As part of my Bachelor Praktikum, I collaborated with a team to create this platform that allows engineers to simulate, test, and visualize complex mechanical systems before physical implementation.

Key Features

  • Real-time Simulation: The system provides real-time physics-based simulation of mechanical components and systems.
  • 3D Visualization: Advanced 3D rendering allows engineers to visualize their designs from any angle and perspective.
  • Collaborative Environment: Multiple team members can work simultaneously on the same project with real-time updates.
  • Testing Framework: Built-in testing tools to validate mechanical designs against various parameters and conditions.
  • Version Control: Complete history tracking of design changes with the ability to revert to previous versions.

Technical Implementation

The Kraken project was built using a modern technology stack:

  • Backend: Python with Django for the server-side application logic and API
  • Frontend: React.js for creating a responsive and interactive user interface
  • Simulation Engine: Custom physics engine written in Python with optimized C++ components
  • 3D Rendering: Three.js for browser-based 3D visualization
  • Containerization: Docker for consistent deployment across development and production environments

My Role and Contributions

As a key member of the development team, my responsibilities included:

  • Developing the frontend interface using React.js to provide an intuitive user experience
  • Implementing the API endpoints in Django to connect the frontend with the simulation engine
  • Creating data visualization components to display simulation results in meaningful ways
  • Collaborating with mechanical engineering students to understand and implement domain-specific requirements
  • Setting up the Docker containerization for streamlined development and deployment

Challenges and Solutions

One of the significant challenges was optimizing the simulation engine for performance while maintaining accuracy. To address this:

  • We implemented multi-threading to parallelize computationally intensive operations
  • We developed a custom caching system to store and reuse common simulation results
  • We created a progressive level-of-detail system that adjusts simulation complexity based on required precision

Results and Outcomes

The Kraken project achieved significant results:

  • Reduced design iteration time by 40% for mechanical engineering projects
  • Improved design quality by enabling engineers to identify and fix issues before physical prototyping
  • Enhanced collaboration among multidisciplinary teams working on complex mechanical systems
  • Received recognition from the faculty for innovation in engineering education tools

Project Details

Duration

6 months

Role

Full Stack Developer

Team Size

5 developers

Technologies Used

{['Python', 'Django', 'React', 'Three.js', 'Docker', 'WebSockets', 'PostgreSQL'].map((tech, index) => ( {tech} ))}

Key Responsibilities

  • Frontend Development
  • API Implementation
  • Docker Configuration
  • Data Visualization
